com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event

Interface SearchListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GenericExceptionListener

    public interface SearchListener
extends GenericExceptionListener
    A SearchListener handles all the search related events. It enables you to get the user status even if a verification is still in progress.

    To register for receiving search events add the listener to the search call VerifyClient.getUserStatus(String, String, SearchListener)

    Example usage: 

         myVerifyClient.getUserStatus("GB", "070000000000", new SearchListener() {
         @Override
         public void onUserStatus(final UserStatus userStatus) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }

         @Override
         public void onError(final VerifyError errorCode) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }
     }

      • onUserStatus

        void onUserStatus(UserStatus userStatus)
        Indicates the current user status.
        Parameters:
        userStatus - The user status, one of the following: UserStatus.USER_PENDING UserStatus.USER_VERIFIED UserStatus.USER_UNVERIFIED UserStatus.USER_EXPIRED UserStatus.USER_FAILED UserStatus.USER_BLACKLISTED UserStatus.USER_UNKNOWN

      • onError

        void onError(VerifyError errorCode,
           java.lang.String errorMessage)
        The search request has been rejected.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - The VerifyError codes to describe the error.
        errorMessage - The message that describes the VerifyError.
